1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Derek is excited because his father Anthony is moving into the home. When Anthony arrives he is a hard-drinking womanizer keen for sex with the female residents but he has been somewhat estranged from Derek and asks him to draw up a wish list to help him to do something nice for his son. Hannah is moved by the result. Vicky puts Derek on Twitter with his message Be Nice to Animals whilst Derek and Dougie are annoyed by new worker Geoffrey, to the extent that Dougie quits his job.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Following Dougie's departure Kev decides to apply for the post of the home's caretaker and dons a suit and a dead man's tie, as well as vowing to give up the Special Brew. For all that he fails to get the job. Meanwhile Hannah and Tom's efforts to try for a baby become very public knowledge whilst Derek's guileless belief that friendship is more important than money first baffles and then impresses financier Pete, who is visiting his grandfather at the home.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: There is much celebration at the home as Hannah discovers that she is pregnant, after which she sees off a loutish boyfriend of Vicki with a rolling pin. Anthony takes fellow resident Annie out on a date, causing Derek to worry that they might get married and then split up whilst Kev persuades Derek to try online dating but is appalled when Derek's first reply comes from Kev's own bit on the side. Kev is very depressed as a result and calls on his brother Cliff to visit to cheer him up. To everybody's astonishment Cliff is even scruffier and cruder than Kev.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Derek surprises everybody with his knowledge of sign language when a deaf woman applies to be a resident, after which he joins an outing to London Zoo where he enjoys himself with the animals and Vicky is charmed by Andy, a resting actor working at the zoo, with whom she makes a date. Back at the home the callous, sadistic Geoff is in charge, making it clear that he despises the old folk. Sure enough Andy phones Vicky for a date on her return but she has to put it on hold as she rushes to help Hannah, who is suffering a miscarriage.

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: Derek is given heartbreaking news, whilst the weight of the world begins to fall on Hannah as she struggles to cope with problems in the care home.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: Derek gets a date via the Internet with a woman called Tracey. All the staff and residents are pleased for him, except the jealous Geoff, who tries to sabotage Derek by making him spill a fizzy drink down his jumper though when Kev stands up for him and Geoff pushes him Derek is uncharacteristically aggressive. As Geoff apologizes to Hannah Derek meets Tracey in a French bistro where, despite his being confused by the menu and mistaking the towels for mints, the date goes fairly well. On return Derek keeps a vigil by the ailing Anthony's bedside . The old man dies but...

7.title: Christmas Special
7.plot: The Broadhill residents are planning for a wedding. Derek goes on another date. Kev's behaviour provokes an extreme reaction from Hannah. Vicky prepares to take over from Hannah.

0.title: Pilot
0.plot: When a documentary team visits the retirement home where he works,kindly,simple, middle-aged Derek is delighted as he loves reality TV - especially Secret Millionaire - and has 35,000 autographs. Douglas,his co-worker and landlord,is less impressed. In the course of the day Derek falls into a pond,sets up his friend Hannah with a date with a handsome visitor and takes the death of a resident to heart.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Councillors seeking to make cuts visit the home with a view to its closure. They are unimpressed by Dougie's lack of training,Derek keeping tadpoles in a chamber pot and the discovery of sex-mad home hanger- on Kev in bed with an elderly lady. Derek believes that a petition should be got up and takes to the streets to rally support though it has little effect. Dougie's outburst however is rather more successful.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Teen-ager Vicki arrives to work at the home as community service for stealing shoes from the shop where she worked. Obsessed with Victoria Beckham - whom she believes she resembles - she is initially reluctant to get on with her chores but the elderly residents win over her and she is thrilled when Hannah praises her work. It's Derek's fiftieth birthday and,as Hannah is giving him a party, he is anxious to ask for his favourite food and music. Dougie goes to the library to change the residents' books and takes Derek,who wants to look at books about cats,and Kev,who ...

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Derek finds a baby bird that has fallen out of its nest and calls an ambulance but by the time it arrives the bird has died. Shelley,uncaring daughter of resident Marge,annoys Hannah as she clearly only visits to keep in with her mother so she can inherit her valuable ring. Hannah is dating Tom,son of another resident,but repeated crises mean she keeps standing him up. The latest emergency involves Marge who,aware she has not long to live,bequeaths the ring to Hannah and Tom so that they can afford to get married.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: To raise money for the home Derek tries to sell autographs to a memorabilia shop but unfortunately cannot remember whose signatures they are. He cheers up as Dougie drives him,the residents and Kev for a day out on Broadstairs beach where,typically,Kev writes obscenities on crabs' shells. Back at the home Hannah welcomes new resident Jill Shaw and is less than pleased to find the old lady's daughter Rebecca is a former school-mate who looks down on Hannah for having a dead end job. When the day trippers return Rebecca is even more scathing but fortunately her mother ...

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Hannah and the staff are planning a show for the residents. Derek is keen to try out his ventriloquism,despite his inability to pronounce the word,whilst Kev wants to put on his musical tribute to Duran Duran. Derek befriends new worker Deon,on Community Service for stealing trainers,who also bonds with fellow shoe thief Vicky. Come the night of the show Derek's act is appalling and Kev's contribution so bad the audience thinks it is a comedy and enjoys it for the wrong reasons. Fortunately Deon saves the day with his rap telling how he has come to respect the ...

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Hannah tells Derek his long lost father Anthony has got in touch but Derek has no desire to see him,claiming that Anthony walked out on the family. Hannah is surprised that the usually placid Derek is so vocal in his argument. Resident Lizzie dies,causing Derek,Hannah,Dougie and Kev to reflect on their lives to camera. Anthony turns up at Lizzie's funeral and Derek,after initial rejection,is finally reconciled with him.

imdb.plot outline: With Derek, Ricky Gervais forays back into comedy with a sensitive format that sheds awareness along its humorous path. Styled in mockumentary fashion, Derek (Ricky Gervais) is the story of a man who works in a British nursing home, helping to care for its residents. While Derek could be said to suffer somewhat, lacking in some mental faculty, this remains debatable throughout. The story takes place primarily within the nursing home, yet does venture beyond those walls into the world of the norm. The character subjects vary from typically aged to otherwise different-from-norm. Derek's primary colleague is Hannah (Kerry Godliman), who has apparently worked in the home for some time and exhibits great care toward her subjects.
imdb.title: Derek
plot: _Derek_ (qv) is a loyal nursing home care assistant who sees only the good in his quirky co-workers as they struggle against prejudice and shrinking budgets to care for their elderly residents.::Netflix

With _Derek_ (qv), 'Ricky Gervais' (qv) forays back into comedy with a sensitive format that sheds awareness along its humorous path. Styled in mockumentary fashion, _Derek_ (qv) ('Ricky Gervais' (qv)) is the story of a man who works in a British nursing home, helping to care for its residents. While _Derek_ (qv) could be said to suffer somewhat, lacking in some mental faculty, this remains debatable throughout. The story takes place primarily within the nursing home, yet does venture beyond those walls into the world of the norm. The character subjects vary from typically aged to otherwise different-from-norm. _Derek_ (qv)'s primary colleague is Hannah (Kerry Godliman), who has apparently worked in the home for some time and exhibits great care toward her subjects.::Angela T.
